channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVIDSafe downloads continue to rise, global COVID-19 cases top 3.7 million as Australian death toll stands at 97

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: The owner of the Melbourne abattoir at the heart of Victoria's biggest coronavirus cluster was a Victorian Labor Party member for more than two decades.
item.title: Cedar Meats boss was long-time ALP member

item.description: They said governments have failed to consider the needs of indigenous people and they need other funding to buy food, medicine and masks.
item.title: Amazon indigenous groups raise own funds to fight coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The new track has been under construction since last year.
item.title: Track linking Mt Coot-tha summit to gardens opens next week

item.dc:creator: Mex Cooper
item.description: From bike rides, to FaceTime and restricted screen time ... here's how parents are keeping their kids occupied.
item.title: Readers share their tips on coping with kids at home

item.dc:creator: Max Presnell
item.description: Darby McCarthy died on Thursday and will be remembered as worthy of a place among the greats jockeys in Australia.
item.title: Richard 'Darby' McCarthy leaves a legacy of breaking barriers in the saddle

item.dc:creator: Mex Cooper
item.description: Life in lockdown for many of our readers has meant a slower pace, time with family, and small surprises and new experiences that have brought unexpected joy.
item.title: Readers find silver linings to life in lockdown

item.description: Is Gervais' tar-black comedy about a grieving husband who doesn't care about himself or others a tonic too bitter for the coronavirus era?
item.title: Ricky Gervais ponders the afterlife and life after the Golden Globes

item.description: Philip Hensher's latest novel is driven by curiosity.
item.title: A brilliant look at politics and friendship

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: John Barilaro revealed that he travelled from his home near Queanbeyan to his Dungowan Estate over the weekend. The farm is described as a "luxury escape".
item.title: 'Gross hypocrisy': Barilaro accused of double standards over farm visit

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: Two of WA football's biggest stars have confirmed their clubs are resigned to resuming the AFL season interstate.
item.title: WA footy stars say teammates ready for interstate challenge

item.dc:creator: Natalie Reilly
item.description: The photo, which has received over 170,000 comments, and spawned dozens of articles in the 24 hours since it went up, all focused on one thing: her weight loss.
item.title: Adele's birthday post reared an uncomfortable obsession... again

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Mines Minister Anthony Lynham said after sweeping reforms and a safety reset, it was "extremely disappointing" to see more accidents.
item.title: Inquiry into mine explosion on the cards after five men suffer serious burns

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Bjorn Baker believes Ocean Emperor can measure up to a trip north for the group 1 JJ Atkins during the abridged Brisbane winter carnival.
item.title: Baker to test JJ Atkins plans for Ocean Emperor

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: Australians sit on average for 10 hours a day, and it might be more during the pandemic. New research shows we need to move more - for our mental health, too.
item.title: Feeling down? Moody? Your sitting time may be the culprit

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: On Friday night, Socceroos pair Adam Taggart and Terry Antonis will become the first Australian footballers anywhere in the world to resume their careers.
item.title: 'A pretty crazy scenario': The first Australian players to kick a ball in anger in months

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: A prominent businessman is suing Mills Oakley, accusing the law firm of losing almost $1 million to hackers who pretended to be his personal assistant Janice.
item.title: Law firm accused of losing $1 million of client's money in email scam

item.description: Jason Day says he would love to face off against Adam Scott at the Australian Open but the late-season Masters could keep Australia's top male golfers from returning this year.
item.title: Late Masters an issue for Australian Open, says Day

item.dc:creator: Aja Styles
item.description: Health Minister Roger Cook has urged people not to become complacent on Mother's Day as WA enters second week of zero COVID-19 cases, with only 20 recorded influenza cases.
item.title: WA's coronavirus clamp-down yields historic low in influenza cases

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Erika Freingruber, 80, fell at her Beaudesert home in the Scenic Rim at the end of last month and suffered a broken hip.
item.title: 'My lifesavers, my angels': Erika stranded for four days after fall at home

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Mathematicians have added their help to the search for coronavirus solutions, developing a simulation of the virus to help track its spread.
item.title: COVID-19 simulator could help track virus spread as restrictions eased

item.dc:creator: Tory Maguire
item.description: Europe correspondent Bevan Shields joins national editor Tory Maguire to discuss the spread of COVID-19 in the United Kingdom.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: UK's death toll surpasses Italy

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: These are the main findings about Cardinal George Pell revealed in unredacted parts of the child abuse royal commission's reports.
item.title: Royal commission's key findings on Pell

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Time-limits on dining, spaced-out tables and disposable menus could be among the list of rules imposed on Queensland restaurants and cafes when they reopen.
item.title: Decision on opening Queensland pubs, restaurants expected tomorrow

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Snitz surprised trainer Matt Dunn first-up and earned a crack at Saturday's Takeover Target Stakes at Randwick's transferred Gosford standalone meeting.
item.title: Dunn to test Snitz at a new level in the Takeover Target

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Greenslopes Private Hospital in Brisbane is using helper robots to keep doctors and patients distant but connected during the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: The robot doctor helping treat hospital patients during a pandemic

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: George Pell failed to investigate complaints against two Melbourne priests and was probably at meetings where allegations against four others were discussed.
item.title: Inquiry finds Pell failed to act on complaints about Melbourne priests

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The $50,000 donation was announced in mid-February when the pandemic was beginning to hit Australia.
item.title: Money set aside for Chinese PPE donation 'reabsorbed' into Brisbane budget

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: state has only 50 active cases as premier discusses options to reopen cafes and restaurants

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Justin Narrier admitted he was on a “cocktail of drugs” when he accessed a ward cupboard and stole two scalpels and tape to construct the double-edged make-shift weapon.
item.title: Drug-fuelled patient jailed after stabbing Perth nurse in the neck with shiv

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: A Perth Airport spokesman claimed Qantas was engaging in “extraordinary corporate spin”.
item.title: Qantas and Perth Airport continue to clash as aviation sector nosedives

item.description: Under O'Hara graduate films were sold to eight countries around the world.
item.title: Film school director helped take new talent worldwide

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The NRL has quashed plans to allow players to catch up with their families on Mother's Day.
item.title: NRL bans players from Mother's Day visits, postpones contact sessions

item.description: Hawthorn president Jeff Kennett has hit out at Tasmanian premier Peter Gutwein for suggesting the state is unwilling to host AFL games without crowds.
item.title: 'Very selfish': Hawks president Kennett hits out at Tasmania

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Three superannuation funds have backed a call by activists for targets to reduce the insurer's investments and underwriting exposure to oil and gas assets.
item.title: QBE shareholders push for greater transparency on oil and gas projects

item.description: Putting away a little extra cash now can make a huge difference to your retirement income.
item.title: How much cash do you really need to retire?

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Friday's Inglis Chairman's Sale offers some unprecedented opportunities for breeders to buy into some of racing's best families.
item.title: Samaready set to star at Chairman's Sale

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: The economic downturn could have a silver lining for children who need foster care, because people are more likely to volunteer as carers.
item.title: Pandemic heightens demand for foster carers

item.description: Dave Greenfield's harpsichord gave the Stranglers' best-loved song its hypnotic charm.
item.title: COVID-19 takes life of rock band keyboardist

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: George Pell knew nearly 30 years ago that paedophile priest Gerard Ridsdale was being moved out of small country parish to protect Catholic Church from scandal.
item.title: Pell knew in 1982 that Ridsdale was being moved to keep lid on scandal

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: The supermarket giant is accelerating its push to automate its supply chain and speed up home deliveries in the coronavirus pandemic, signing a major deal for two high-tech sheds in Sydney and Melbourne.
item.title: Home delivery surge puts focus on Coles' high-tech sheds

item.description: Getting Australia's temporary migration mix right is more complicated - and important - than the government or Labor would suggest.
item.title: The political football that is skilled temporary migration

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The developer planning to build homes on an unburnt patch of forest on the NSW South Coast has agreed to a two-week halt in land clearing while discussions about a land swap proceed.
item.title: Developers may spare remnant patch of unburnt coastal forest

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: These are the conditions the NRL anti-vaxxers refused to agree with as part of their protest against the NRL's vaccination policy.
item.title: The sentences NRL anti-vaxxers are crossing out of the waiver

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: In a defamatory Facebook post falsely claiming a Sydney man "gets his kicks intimidating, bullying and threatening women, the woman who wrote it claimed it "isn't slander if it's true".
item.title: Avoided at the shops, whispers and pointing: the $35,000 Facebook post

item.description: Earlier on Thursday, China's Ambassador in Wellington, Wu Xi, wrote to Ardern's government in an attempt to curtail Kiwi support.
item.title: In aftermath of outbreak, New Zealand jumps on board Taiwan WHO push

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: The child abuse royal commission rejected Cardinal George Pell's evidence that he was deceived by Catholic Church officials about paedophile priests.
item.title: Royal commission finds Pell 'conscious' of priests abusing children in early '70s

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: The Premier rejected the state opposition's criticisms as 'irrelevant' while insisting there will be no loosening of social restrictions before Mother's Day on Sunday.
item.title: Andrews slams 'silly political games' as abattoir outbreak spreads

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: The state government has abandoned a pilot program to house rough sleepers in Perth's five-star hotels after more than half of the participants walked out mid-trial.
item.title: WA government scraps homeless hotel program after participants walk out within days
